segment.source: Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.
segment.target: Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.

segment.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.
segment.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.

segment.source: Check whether the task is already registered.
segment.target: Check whether the task is already registered.

segment.source: It's important to check this because if a task is registered multiple times, it will run more than once whenever it’s triggered; this can use excess CPU and may cause unexpected behavior.
segment.target: It's important to check this because if a task is registered multiple times, it will run more than once whenever it’s triggered; this can use excess CPU and may cause unexpected behavior.

segment.source: You can check for existing registrations by querying the BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks property and iterating on the result.
segment.target: You can check for existing registrations by querying the BackgroundTaskRegistration.AllTasks property and iterating on the result.

segment.source: Check the name of each instance – if it matches the name of the task you’re registering, then break out of the loop and set a flag variable so that your code can choose a different path in the next step.
segment.target: Check the name of each instance – if it matches the name of the task you’re registering, then break out of the loop and set a flag variable so that your code can choose a different path in the next step.
